subSections.title: Translingual
subSections.text: {{Han simplified forms|兩|両|两}}

subSections.title: Han character
subSections.text: {{Han char|rn=1|rad=一|as=05|sn=6|four=1022.7|canj=MUB|ids=⿱一⿻冂山,⿻⿱一山冂}}

subSections.title: Chinese
subSections.text: {{zh-see|兩|v}}

subSections.title: Kanji 1
Readings
Compounds
Kanji 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanji|grade=3|rs=一05}}

# [[counter]] for [[carriages]], such as in a [[train]]

subSections.title: Readings
Usage notes
subSections.text: Usually replaces {{m|ja|輛}} and extended shinjitai form {{m|ja|輌}} in modern usage.

subSections.title: Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|両|両 (as both weight and currency)}} {{wikipedia|Ryō|Ryō (as a unit of currency)}} {{wikipedia|Tael|Tael (''ryō'' or ''koro'' as a unit of weight)}}
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|りょう}} From {{der|ja|ltc|sort=りょう|兩|tr=lɨɐŋH||two, both}}.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text:
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|りょう|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}
* This pitch accent only applies when this is used as a standalone noun.

subSections.title: Noun
Prefix
subSections.text:
{{ja-pos|prefix|りょう|kyu=兩|hhira=りやう}}

# [[both]]

subSections.title: Derived terms
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ころ}}
From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=ころ|-}}. Possibly related to root ''koro'' in reference to rolling, as in {{m|ja|転ぶ|tr=korobu||to tumble, to fall; to roll}}, {{m|ja|ころころ|tr=korokoro||rollingly}}.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|ころ}}

subSections.title: Counter
subSections.text:
{{ja-pos|counter|ころ|kyu=兩}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=ころ|obsolete}} a [[traditional]] unit of [[weight]], roughly equivalent to 37.5 [[gram]]s

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: The ''koro'' reading appears to be obsolete, [[supersede]]d by ''ryō'' above.

subSections.title: Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|りょう}}
Probably from {{der|ja|ltc|sort=りょう|輛|tr=lɨɐŋ<sup>H</sup>?|pos=counter for vehicles}}.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|りょう}}
